metadata.title: CVE-2024-23280 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An injection issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue isfixed in Safari 17.4, macOS Sonoma 14.4, iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4, watchOS10.4, tvOS 17.4. A maliciously crafted webpage may be able to fingerprintthe user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-23280` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.44.0-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
